title: FLAB: Is there a way to subtract overlaps?
content: In most vector editing programs I can use one contour to remove its shape from another contour. In Illustrator this is the “Subtract From Shape Area” feature. Is there some trick/macro for doing this with Fontlab’s drawing tools?
author: James Puckett

comments.content:
Get two shapes, both must have a different direction!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203095802im_/http:/typophile.com/files/afb1_3706.png)

Overlap.  
Merge contours.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203095802im_/http:/typophile.com/files/afb2_6118.png)

Remove the part you don’t like to have.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203095802im_/http:/typophile.com/files/afb3_6603.png)

:)  
Pieter

Or is this no what you mean?

Pieter
That works. I was just hoping that I was overlooking a simpler function. Thanks!
James, while it will work the way Pieter described, you can just right-click on the contour you want to subtrect and select a command from the Contour menu :)
Wow, yes, should that be rather "right-click on a _node_ of the contour you want to subtract"? Thanks, Yuri.
